solution_line_template: Four hats, each with three stripes, is {num_hats_group1}*{stripes_per_hat_group1}=<<{num_hats_group1}*{stripes_per_hat_group1}={stripes_group1}>>{stripes_group1} stripes.
Three hats with four stripes each is {num_hats_group2}*{stripes_per_hat_group2}=<<{num_hats_group2}*{stripes_per_hat_group2}={stripes_group2}>>{stripes_group2} stripes.
Six hats with no stripes is {num_hats_group3}*{stripes_per_hat_group3} = <<{num_hats_group3}*{stripes_per_hat_group3}={stripes_group3}>>{stripes_group3} stripes.
And two hats with {stripes_per_hat_group4} stripes each is {num_hats_group4}*{stripes_per_hat_group4}=<<{num_hats_group4}*{stripes_per_hat_group4}={stripes_group4}>>{stripes_group4} stripes.

The combined total number of stripes Vaishali has on all of her hats is {stripes_group1}+{stripes_group2}+{stripes_group3}+{stripes_group4}=<<{stripes_group1}+{stripes_group2}+{stripes_group3}+{stripes_group4}={total_stripes}>>{total_stripes} stripes.
